citeinfo.title: Sea Level Rise Analysis in Copano and San Antonio Bays, Texas

descript.abstract: This dataset shows the extent of the loss of existing irregularly flooded and regularly flooded marshes by 2100 under a 1 m SLR scenario in Copano and San Antonio Bays, Texas. SLAMM was used to predict the future distribution of marshes and the marsh persistence and loss calculations were summarized by each individual marsh polygon.
descript.purpose: These marsh polygons were used in the analysis of marsh conservation and resiliency through a 1m sea level rise scenario by 2100.

idinfo.accconst: Data access constraints follow the guidelines as posted on coastalresilience.org or gulfsealevelrise.org
idinfo.useconst: Data use constraints follow the guidelines as posted on coastalresilience.org or gulfsealevelrise.org
idinfo.datacred: This project is funded by GLO Contract No. 15-032-000-8374 and is supported by data collected by research staff of the Coastal Studies group, Near Surface Observatory, Bureau of Economic Geology, Jackson School of Geosciences, The University of Texas at Austin. This project was supported by grant no. 13-268-000-7485 from the General Land Office of Texas to the BEG. Jeffrey G. Paine served as the principal investigator. The project was funded under a Coastal Impact Assistance Program grant made available to the State of Texas by the U. S. Department of the Interior, U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service.
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.3.1.4959

attracc.attraccr: No formal attribute accuracy tests were conducted.

dataqual.logic: No formal logical accuracy tests were conducted.
dataqual.complete: Data set is considered complete for the information presented, as described in the abstract. Users are advised to read the rest of the metadata record carefully for additional details.

horizpa.horizpar: A formal accuracy assessment of the horizontal positional information in the data set has not been conducted.

vertacc.vertaccr: A formal accuracy assessment of the vertical positional information in the data set has either not been conducted, or is not applicable.

overview.eaover: The entity and attribute information provided here describes the tabular data associated with the data set. Please review the detailed descriptions that are provided (the individual attribute descriptions) for information on the values that appear as fields/table entries of the data set.
